comments:
i tried to save my project and an error-message popped up that said: "Errors 
during build"... i clicked on "details" and it 
said:"java.lang.NullPointerException encountered while running 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.builder.JavaBuilder"..

this happened after i added a string variable-declaration..

Can you provide steps to reproduce ? Also, could you paste in this PR the 
content of the .log file (under your workspace .metadata/ folder).

i declared quite a lot of string variables but didnt use them yet. after that i 
tried to save. in "preferences -> java -> compiler" the field "unused 
parameters" was on "warning".. thats how the exception was produced. later i 
found out that if i turn this compiler-option to "ignore" the exception doesnt 
occur anymore... (probably there were too many warnings???)
